timeAnchors.definition: The date of randomization via IVRS call
timeAnchors.sourceText: The treatment phase begins with the randomization call to the IVRS. ... OS is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death due to any cause in all randomized subjects.

repetitions.sourceText: On treatment visits will occur at Day 1 and every 2 weeks thereafter.
Tumor imaging assessments will occur 8 weeks from the date of randomization (+/-1 wk), then every 8 weeks (+/- 1 wk) thereafter up to 48 weeks

repetitions.exitCondition: disease progression or treatment is discontinued (whichever occurs later)
repetitions.sourceText: then it will be every 12 weeks (+/- 1 week) until disease progression or treatment is discontinued (whichever occurs later).
Survival status will be assessed every 3 months after follow up visits are completed
Subjects will be treated until unacceptable toxicity or disease progression.

executionTypes.rationale: Administered 240 mg IV every 2 weeks until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
Administered 400 mg PO BID until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
Continuous monitoring of survival status from randomization until death or study completion.
Determined by BICR based on RECIST 1.1, which involves repeated imaging assessments at scheduled intervals.
Conditional workflow requiring a follow-up scan only if an initial Complete Response or Partial Response is observed.
Collected from subjects at baseline only from selected sites.
Conditional workflow performed locally if the Central Laboratory is unable to perform the test.
Conditional workflows triggered by the occurrence of specific adverse events or toxicities.

footnoteConditions.sourceText: Within 14 days prior to first dose.

footnoteConditions.text: Including BP, HR, temperature, respiratory rate. Obtain vital signs at the screening visit and within 72 hours prior to first dose.

footnoteConditions.text: Serum or urine pregnancy test (minimum sensitivity 25 IU/L or equivalent units of HCG) to be done within 24 hours prior to first dose, and then monthly regardless of dosing schedule

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Overall Survival (OS)

timeWindow.duration: until death or last known alive date

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: OS = date of death - date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Subjects who are alive will be censored at the last known alive dates.
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: OS is defined as the time from the date of randomization to the date of death due to any cause in all randomized subjects. Subjects who are alive will be censored at the last known alive dates.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Objective Response Rate (ORR)

timeWindow.duration: every 8 weeks up to 48 weeks, then every 12 weeks

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: ORR = (subjects with confirmed CR + subjects with confirmed PR) / total randomized subjects
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Confirmed CR or PR as determined by BICR based on RECIST 1.1
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: ORR will be determined from assessment by a blinded independent central review (BICR) based on RECIST 1.1. ... Added requirement for confirmatory scan to be performed for CR/PR assessment of best over

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Progression Free Survival (PFS)

timeWindow.duration: every 8 weeks up to 48 weeks, then every 12 weeks

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: PFS = (date of first objective progression or death) - date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Determined from assessments by a BICR based on RECIST 1.1
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: PFS will be determined from assessments by a blinded independent central review (BICR) based on RECIST 1.1

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Tumor PD-L1 expression and efficacy
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Correlation analysis between PD-L1 expression levels and efficacy endpoints (OS, ORR, PFS)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Evaluation of the relationship between expression and efficacy
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: To evaluate the relationship between tumor PD-L1 expression and efficacy

derivedVariables.name: Overall Survival (OS)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Date of Death - Date of Randomization
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: From randomization until death or last known alive date
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Subjects who are alive will be censored at the last known alive dates

derivedVariables.name: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Proportion of subjects with a best overall response of CR or PR, requiring a confirmatory scan
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Every 8 weeks (+/- 1 wk) up to 48 weeks, then every 12 weeks (+/- 1 wk)

doseModifications: Subjects may be treated beyond disease progression under protocol-defined conditions
